trans-unit.source: Use speech recognition to provide input, specify an action or command, and accomplish tasks.
trans-unit.target: Use speech recognition to provide input, specify an action or command, and accomplish tasks.

trans-unit.source: Speech recognition
trans-unit.target: Speech recognition

trans-unit.source: Speech recognition
trans-unit.target: Speech recognition

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Use speech recognition to provide input, specify an action or command, and accomplish tasks.
trans-unit.target: Use speech recognition to provide input, specify an action or command, and accomplish tasks.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.Media.SpeechRecognition
trans-unit.target: Windows.Media.SpeechRecognition

trans-unit.source: Speech recognition is made up of a speech runtime, recognition APIs for programming the runtime, ready-to-use grammars for dictation and web search, and a default system UI that helps users discover and use speech recognition features.
trans-unit.target: Speech recognition is made up of a speech runtime, recognition APIs for programming the runtime, ready-to-use grammars for dictation and web search, and a default system UI that helps users discover and use speech recognition features.

trans-unit.source: Set up the audio feed
trans-unit.target: Set up the audio feed

trans-unit.source: Ensure that your device has a microphone or the equivalent.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that your device has a microphone or the equivalent.

trans-unit.source: Set the **Microphone** device capability ([**DeviceCapability**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211430)) in the [App package manifest](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211474) (**package.appxmanifest** file) to get access to the microphone’s audio feed.
trans-unit.target: Set the **Microphone** device capability ([**DeviceCapability**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211430)) in the [App package manifest](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211474) (**package.appxmanifest** file) to get access to the microphone’s audio feed.

trans-unit.source: This allows the app to record audio from connected microphones.
trans-unit.target: This allows the app to record audio from connected microphones.

trans-unit.source: See [App capability declarations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270968).
trans-unit.target: See [App capability declarations](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270968).

trans-unit.source: Recognize speech input
trans-unit.target: Recognize speech input

trans-unit.source: A *constraint* defines the words and phrases (vocabulary) that an app recognizes in speech input.
trans-unit.target: A *constraint* defines the words and phrases (vocabulary) that an app recognizes in speech input.

trans-unit.source: Constraints are at the core of speech recognition and give your app great over the accuracy of speech recognition.
trans-unit.target: Constraints are at the core of speech recognition and give your app great over the accuracy of speech recognition.

trans-unit.source: You can use various types of constraints when performing speech recognition:
trans-unit.target: You can use various types of constraints when performing speech recognition:

trans-unit.source: **Predefined grammars** ([**SpeechRecognitionTopicConstraint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631446)).
trans-unit.target: **Predefined grammars** ([**SpeechRecognitionTopicConstraint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631446)).

trans-unit.source: Predefined dictation and web-search grammars provide speech recognition for your app without requiring you to author a grammar.
trans-unit.target: Predefined dictation and web-search grammars provide speech recognition for your app without requiring you to author a grammar.

trans-unit.source: When using these grammars, speech recognition is performed by a remote web service and the results are returned to the device.
trans-unit.target: When using these grammars, speech recognition is performed by a remote web service and the results are returned to the device.

trans-unit.source: The default free-text dictation grammar can recognize most words and phrases that a user can say in a particular language, and is optimized to recognize short phrases.
trans-unit.target: The default free-text dictation grammar can recognize most words and phrases that a user can say in a particular language, and is optimized to recognize short phrases.

trans-unit.source: The predefined dictation grammar is used if you don't specify any constraints for your [**SpeechRecognizer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653226) object.
trans-unit.target: The predefined dictation grammar is used if you don't specify any constraints for your [**SpeechRecognizer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653226) object.

trans-unit.source: Free-text dictation is useful when you don't want to limit the kinds of things a user can say.
trans-unit.target: Free-text dictation is useful when you don't want to limit the kinds of things a user can say.

trans-unit.source: Typical uses include creating notes or dictating the content for a message.
trans-unit.target: Typical uses include creating notes or dictating the content for a message.

trans-unit.source: The web-search grammar, like a dictation grammar, contains a large number of words and phrases that a user might say.
trans-unit.target: The web-search grammar, like a dictation grammar, contains a large number of words and phrases that a user might say.

trans-unit.source: However, it is optimized to recognize terms that people typically use when searching the web.
trans-unit.target: However, it is optimized to recognize terms that people typically use when searching the web.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Because predefined dictation and web-search grammars can be large, and because they are online (not on the device), performance might not be as fast as with a custom grammar installed on the device.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Because predefined dictation and web-search grammars can be large, and because they are online (not on the device), performance might not be as fast as with a custom grammar installed on the device.

trans-unit.source: These predefined grammars can be used to recognize up to 10 seconds of speech input and require no authoring effort on your part.
trans-unit.target: These predefined grammars can be used to recognize up to 10 seconds of speech input and require no authoring effort on your part.

trans-unit.source: However, they do require a connection to a network.
trans-unit.target: However, they do require a connection to a network.

trans-unit.source: To use web-service constraints, speech input and dictation support must be enabled in **Settings** by turning on the "Get to know me" option in the Settings -> Privacy -> Speech, inking, and typing page.
trans-unit.target: To use web-service constraints, speech input and dictation support must be enabled in **Settings** by turning on the "Get to know me" option in the Settings -> Privacy -> Speech, inking, and typing page.

trans-unit.source: Here, we show how to test whether speech input is enabled and open the Settings -> Privacy -> Speech, inking, and typing page, if not.
trans-unit.target: Here, we show how to test whether speech input is enabled and open the Settings -> Privacy -> Speech, inking, and typing page, if not.

trans-unit.source: First, we initialize a global variable (HResultPrivacyStatementDeclined) to the HResult value of 0x80045509.
trans-unit.target: First, we initialize a global variable (HResultPrivacyStatementDeclined) to the HResult value of 0x80045509.

trans-unit.source: See [Exception handling for in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn532194).
trans-unit.target: See [Exception handling for in C# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn532194).

trans-unit.source: **Programmatic list constraints** ([**SpeechRecognitionListConstraint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631421)).
trans-unit.target: **Programmatic list constraints** ([**SpeechRecognitionListConstraint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631421)).

trans-unit.source: Programmatic list constraints provide a lightweight approach to creating simple grammars using a list of words or phrases.
trans-unit.target: Programmatic list constraints provide a lightweight approach to creating simple grammars using a list of words or phrases.

trans-unit.source: A list constraint works well for recognizing short, distinct phrases.
trans-unit.target: A list constraint works well for recognizing short, distinct phrases.

trans-unit.source: Explicitly specifying all words in a grammar also improves recognition accuracy, as the speech recognition engine must only process speech to confirm a match.
trans-unit.target: Explicitly specifying all words in a grammar also improves recognition accuracy, as the speech recognition engine must only process speech to confirm a match.

trans-unit.source: The list can also be programmatically updated.
trans-unit.target: The list can also be programmatically updated.

trans-unit.source: A list constraint consists of an array of strings that represents speech input that your app will accept for a recognition operation.
trans-unit.target: A list constraint consists of an array of strings that represents speech input that your app will accept for a recognition operation.

trans-unit.source: You can create a list constraint in your app by creating a speech-recognition list-constraint object and passing an array of strings.
trans-unit.target: You can create a list constraint in your app by creating a speech-recognition list-constraint object and passing an array of strings.

trans-unit.source: Then, add that object to the constraints collection of the recognizer.
trans-unit.target: Then, add that object to the constraints collection of the recognizer.

trans-unit.source: Recognition is successful when the speech recognizer recognizes any one of the strings in the array.
trans-unit.target: Recognition is successful when the speech recognizer recognizes any one of the strings in the array.

trans-unit.source: **SRGS grammars** ([**SpeechRecognitionGrammarFileConstraint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631412)).
trans-unit.target: **SRGS grammars** ([**SpeechRecognitionGrammarFileConstraint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn631412)).

trans-unit.source: An Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) grammar is a static document that, unlike a programmatic list constraint, uses the XML format defined by the [SRGS Version 1.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=262302).
trans-unit.target: An Speech Recognition Grammar Specification (SRGS) grammar is a static document that, unlike a programmatic list constraint, uses the XML format defined by the [SRGS Version 1.0](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=262302).

trans-unit.source: An SRGS grammar provides the greatest control over the speech recognition experience by letting you capture multiple semantic meanings in a single recognition.
trans-unit.target: An SRGS grammar provides the greatest control over the speech recognition experience by letting you capture multiple semantic meanings in a single recognition.

trans-unit.source: **Voice command constraints** ([**SpeechRecognitionVoiceCommandDefinitionConstraint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653220))
trans-unit.target: **Voice command constraints** ([**SpeechRecognitionVoiceCommandDefinitionConstraint**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653220))

trans-unit.source: Use a Voice Command Definition (VCD) XML file to define the commands that the user can say to initiate actions when activating your app.
trans-unit.target: Use a Voice Command Definition (VCD) XML file to define the commands that the user can say to initiate actions when activating your app.

trans-unit.source: For more detail, see [Launch a foreground app with voice commands in Cortana](launch-a-foreground-app-with-voice-commands-in-cortana.md).
trans-unit.target: For more detail, see [Launch a foreground app with voice commands in Cortana](launch-a-foreground-app-with-voice-commands-in-cortana.md).

trans-unit.source: **Note** Which type of constraint type you use depends on the complexity of the recognition experience you want to create.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Which type of constraint type you use depends on the complexity of the recognition experience you want to create.

trans-unit.source: Any could be the best choice for a specific recognition task, and you might find uses for all types of constraints in your app.
trans-unit.target: Any could be the best choice for a specific recognition task, and you might find uses for all types of constraints in your app.

trans-unit.source: To get started with constraints, see [Define custom recognition constraints](define-custom-recognition-constraints.md).
trans-unit.target: To get started with constraints, see [Define custom recognition constraints](define-custom-recognition-constraints.md).

trans-unit.source: The predefined Universal Windows app dictation grammar recognizes most words and short phrases in a language.
trans-unit.target: The predefined Universal Windows app dictation grammar recognizes most words and short phrases in a language.

trans-unit.source: It is activated by default when a speech recognizer object is instantiated without custom constraints.
trans-unit.target: It is activated by default when a speech recognizer object is instantiated without custom constraints.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we show how to:
trans-unit.target: In this example, we show how to:

trans-unit.source: Create a speech recognizer.
trans-unit.target: Create a speech recognizer.

trans-unit.source: Compile the default Universal Windows app constraints (no grammars have been added to the speech recognizer's grammar set).
trans-unit.target: Compile the default Universal Windows app constraints (no grammars have been added to the speech recognizer's grammar set).

trans-unit.source: Start listening for speech by using the basic recognition UI and TTS feedback provided by the [**RecognizeWithUIAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653245) method.
trans-unit.target: Start listening for speech by using the basic recognition UI and TTS feedback provided by the [**RecognizeWithUIAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653245) method.

trans-unit.source: Use the [**RecognizeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653244) method if the default UI is not required.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**RecognizeAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653244) method if the default UI is not required.

trans-unit.source: Customize the recognition UI
trans-unit.target: Customize the recognition UI

trans-unit.source: When your app attempts speech recognition by calling [**SpeechRecognizer.RecognizeWithUIAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653245), several screens are shown in the following order.
trans-unit.target: When your app attempts speech recognition by calling [**SpeechRecognizer.RecognizeWithUIAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653245), several screens are shown in the following order.

trans-unit.source: If you're using a constraint based on a predefined grammar (dictation or web search):
trans-unit.target: If you're using a constraint based on a predefined grammar (dictation or web search):

trans-unit.source: The **Listening** screen.
trans-unit.target: The **Listening** screen.

trans-unit.source: The **Thinking** screen.
trans-unit.target: The **Thinking** screen.

trans-unit.source: The **Heard you say** screen or the error screen.
trans-unit.target: The **Heard you say** screen or the error screen.

trans-unit.source: If you're using a constraint based on a list of words or phrases, or a constraint based on a SRGS grammar file:
trans-unit.target: If you're using a constraint based on a list of words or phrases, or a constraint based on a SRGS grammar file:

trans-unit.source: The **Listening** screen.
trans-unit.target: The **Listening** screen.

trans-unit.source: The **Did you say** screen, if what the user said could be interpreted as more than one potential result.
trans-unit.target: The **Did you say** screen, if what the user said could be interpreted as more than one potential result.

trans-unit.source: The **Heard you say** screen or the error screen.
trans-unit.target: The **Heard you say** screen or the error screen.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows an example of the flow between screens for a speech recognizer that uses a constraint based on a SRGS grammar file.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows an example of the flow between screens for a speech recognizer that uses a constraint based on a SRGS grammar file.

trans-unit.source: In this example, speech recognition was successful.
trans-unit.target: In this example, speech recognition was successful.

trans-unit.source: initial recognition screen for a constraint based on a sgrs grammar file
trans-unit.target: initial recognition screen for a constraint based on a sgrs grammar file

trans-unit.source: intermediate recognition screen for a constraint based on a sgrs grammar file
trans-unit.target: intermediate recognition screen for a constraint based on a sgrs grammar file

trans-unit.source: final recognition screen for a constraint based on a sgrs grammar file
trans-unit.target: final recognition screen for a constraint based on a sgrs grammar file

trans-unit.source: The **Listening** screen can provide examples of words or phrases that the app can recognize.
trans-unit.target: The **Listening** screen can provide examples of words or phrases that the app can recognize.

trans-unit.source: Here, we show how to use the properties of the [**SpeechRecognizerUIOptions**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653234) class (obtained by calling the [**SpeechRecognizer.UIOptions**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653254) property) to customize content on the **Listening** screen.
trans-unit.target: Here, we show how to use the properties of the [**SpeechRecognizerUIOptions**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653234) class (obtained by calling the [**SpeechRecognizer.UIOptions**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn653254) property) to customize content on the **Listening** screen.
